snippet: Sushmita Banerjee, an Indian who married an Afghan, was abducted and shot 18 years after being sentenced to death for refusing to wear a burqa in public.
abstract: Sushmita Banerjee, author of popular memoir of life in Afghanistan under the Taliban that was made into a major Bollywood movie, is shot dead, 18 years after being sentenced to death for refusing to wear a burqa in public; Taliban denies responsibility for her death.

byline.contributor: Sharifullah Sahak and Farooq Jan Mangal contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Sushmita Banerjee, an Indian who married an Afghan, was abducted and shot 18 years after being sentenced to death for refusing to wear a burqa in public.

headline.main: Woman Who Wrote About Life Under the Taliban Is Killed
headline.print_headline: Woman Who Wrote on Life Under the Taliban Is Killed
